name: Changing an array element
instruction:
Write a function `changeElement` that takes two parameters, an array and a number.

The array is of arbitrary length and consists of numbers.

If the desired number is in the array, the function should replace it with the opposite sign.

If the desired number is not in the array, assign the value of the sought number to the value of the last element of the array.

The function should return the changed array.

An example of running the function:
```javascript
changeElement([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 3) // [1, 2, -3, 4, 5]
changeElement([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 6) // [1, 2, 3, 4, 6]
changeElement([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 9, 13, 8], 0) // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 9, 13, 0]
changeElement([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 9, 13, 8], 8) // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 9, 13, -8]
```
